div.span: NPCSD Is CLOSED to Students Until Further Notice

span.p:
The New Philadelphia City School District will be closed to students until further notice.
During this time, there will be no school or school-sponsored athletics, activities, or meetings.
Student instruction will continue and food will be available to all children 18 years of age or younger.
Need Technology Support? Call our Technology Help Desk at (866) 779-7748

¿Como puedo contactar con alguien que hable en espanol?
Para hacer cualquier consulta en espanol, rogamos llame al teléfono 330.866.0623
Si no podemos contestar en ese momento, deje su nombre y número de teléfono y le devolveremos la llamada.
IMPORTANT LINK
NPCSD Alternative Learning Plan During Extended School Closure and other COVID-19 Information

div.span: Address: 248 Front Ave SW | New Philadelphia, OH 44663

div.div: Facts About Issue 4&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp/&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strategic Plan&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp/&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parent Portal

span.strong: Students should check their school Email, Canvas, & Google Classroom accounts for more information.

span.div: That is fine! Students without internet access can pick up a packet of lessons and assignments at the Front Administration Building from Tuesday through Friday from 8:00am - 4:00pm. WMS/NPHS parents, please know your child's schedule (e.g. Algebra I, English 9, Art I).
Click on the links below of digital copies of lessons & assignments. (Updated each Monday by Noon)

br.strong: What is the best way to communicate with my child’s teacher and/or principal?
br.br:
Email will be the most effective and efficient way to reach out to any school employee during this time. All emails can be found at http://www.npschools.org/StaffDirectory.aspx
How do I get technology help?
Students & parents/guardians can call the tech support line at 866.779.7748 to access remote assistance for your student’s device from 8am-8pm. Student ID number is needed for verification.

div.strong: My child has an IEP/504 Plan. What can I expect?
div.br:
Lessons for the week will have appropriate adaptations for students with disabilities. Your teacher will be contacting you with more details. IEPs will be completed via phone/virtual conference and will take place within their compliance date.
My child typically gets Speech Therapy, PT, or OT. Can I still obtain those services?
Activities will be available in the appropriate folder on the New Philadelphia homepage. Teletherapy can also be provided. Please call the District at 330.364.0600 or email the Special Services Director at [email protected] to set up an appointment.
